intro: Arthraxon hispidus f. riukiuensis, commonly known as the Ryukyu sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological systems in its native habitat.
